prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: B6 spectral scan
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: Band-6 spectral-scan that covers the redshift range from z = 5.91 to 6.91 for [CII]158.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText:
- Requested sensitivity: As derived in SJ, the expected peak flux density and FWHM of the [CII] line at z ~ 6 is typically 22 mJy (possible range of 5.2-130 mJy) and ~500 km/s, respectively. We will achieve >10-sigma in the typical case and > 5-sigma even in the faintest case, so we request 1-sigma = 1.1 mJy with 100 km/s binning. There are no nearby bright sources around all the targets. Continuum emission (~5-6 mJy) does not affect the sensitivity.
- Imaging requirements: We do not intend to resolve the sources (the expected source size is < 0.5"). We request an angular resolution of ~0.5-1.5 arcsec to pinpoint the counterparts, which are obtained with the C34-1, 2, and 3 configurations. Snapshot images are sufficient for this project, because each of our targets consists of a single (or at most a few) point-like source(s).
- Correlator setup: We will use the spectral-scan mode with FDM 1875-MHz (16-ch averaging). We opt this FDM mode (~10 km/s resolution) rather than the TDM 2000-MHz with no spectral averaging (~30 km/s), because this FDM setup achieves a smaller data rate (1.4 Mbps) than TDM (2.2 Mbps). Five frequency tunings cover 240.14-274.89 GHz. We note that there are a 110 MHz (120 km/s) gap between the band-6 and band-7 coverages. OT does not allow fill the gap, but it is not a matter for the scientific purpose because the gap is narrower than the expected line width. No special setup is intended.
- User-defined calibration: None.
- Bandpass accuracy: The expected FWZI of line is up to 1000 km/s or 0.9 GHz. A spectral response accuracy of 500 is sufficient for all tuning bands.
- Scheduling/time constraints: None.
- Data rate: 1.4 MB/s, well below the data rate limit (12 MB/s).
- Special constraints: None.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: B7 spectral scan
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: Band-7 spectral-scan that covers the redshift range from z = 5.22 to 5.91 for [CII]158.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText:
- Requested sensitivity: The expected peak flux density and FWHM of the [CII] line at z ~ 5.5 is typically 26 mJy (possible range of 7--160 mJy) and ~500 km/s, respectively. Note that the flux is ~20% higher than given in TJ of Band-6 SG because of a slightly smaller luminosity distance. We will achieve > 10-sigma in the typical case and > 5-sigma even in the faintest case (7 mJy), so we request 1-sigma = 1.4 mJy with 100 km/s binning. There are no nearby bright sources around all the targets. Continuum emission (~5-6 mJy) does not affect the sensitivity.
- Imaging requirements: We do not intend to resolve the sources (the expected source size is < 0.5"). We request an angular resolution of ~0.5-1.5 arcsec to pinpoint the counterparts, which are obtained with the C34-1 and 2 configurations. Snapshot images are sufficient for this project, because each of our targets consists of a single (or at most a few) point-like source(s).
- Correlator setup: We will use the spectral-scan mode with FDM 1875-MHz (16-chaveraging). We opt this FDM mode (~10 km/s resolution) rather than the TDM 2000-MHz with no spectral averaging (~30 km/s), because this FDM setup achieves a smaller data rate (1.4 Mbps) than TDM (2.2 Mbps). Five frequency tunings cover 275.0000-305.8125 GHz. We note that there are a 110 MHz (120 km/s) gap between the band-6 and band-7 coverages. OT does not allow fill the gap, but it is not a matter for the scientific purpose because the gap is narrower than the expected line width. No special setup is intended.
- User-defined calibration: None.
- Bandpass accuracy: The expected FWZI of line is up to 1000 km/s or 0.9 GHz. A spectral response accuracy of 500 is sufficient for all tuning bands.
- Scheduling/time constraints: None.
- Data rate: 1.4 MB/s, well below the data rate limit (12 MB/s).
- Special constraints: None.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract:
We propose ALMA Band 6/7 spectral-scan survey of redshifted [C II] 158-um in 13 SPIRE-faint/dropout submm galaxies (SMGs) found in the COSMOS field, which are the most likely candidates for z~6 dusty starburst galaxies. The targets are discovered in our 0.72-deg^2 AzTEC 1.1-mm map, and are selected by 1.1-mm, 500 and 350-um colors. We will scan 240.1-305.8 GHz (5.22 < z < 6.91 for [C II]), and we aim:
(1) to determine redshifts of the SMGs to constrain the obscured part of cosmic star-formation rate density (SFRD) at z~6. It will be a great surprise if ~10 SMGs are spectroscopically confirmed since they account for 30% of the UV/optically-inferred SFRD at z~6. Even if we detect only one source, it still pose a severe challenge to theoretical models of galaxy formation.
(2) to place a constraint on the bright-end of a [C II] luminosity function (LF) at z~6. The [C II] LF is a promising tool to characterize the obscured galaxy formation, but it is ill-constrained. The proposed study will thus improve this further.
Notice that the proposed study is cost-effective: Just 1-hr observation including calibration and overheads will yield one spectroscopic redshift of a z~6 SMG.
prp:ObsProposal.prp:scientificCategoryString: Cosmology and the High Redshift Universe
